EDIT: He's now available on OCE.
Enough of this, let's talk about our lack of URF {{champion:32}} {{item:3070}}

{{champion:136}} The Dank Dragon, Awesome champion But Far too difficult to position since his Stars only hit Edge his radius and not the area around him like a {{item:3068}} the ability also has good damage but would make sense with %Hp damage, {{champion:136}}  Starsurge is Too Fast to keep up with and nurture to make a awesome bang and that too it dose not do enough damage I have tried and gotten close to 400 damage out of it being the size of a lane and not near enough radius of damage as the size of a lane maybe the size of a jungle camp.
I'm am not sure if this is a glitch but when playing the enemy team has told me I was visible to them the whole game I'm aware of his passive which says The Stars can be visible to enemies even in a brush, but i was revealed all game not doing anything in base or where ever. What Happen To {{champion:136}} Escape Velocity it is still called that yet their is no burst of movement speed when hit by a champion was it taken out or is it just not working and also Aurelion Sol shouldn't be able to lose his escape velocity stacks unless their at 100 or its just plain mean. Also i understand silencing or stunning Aurelion Sol should stop his Celestial Expansion but why his passive too theirs soo many other champions which would be great if we could silence their passives too isn't that why their called passives and not actives.

So in other words... He has counterplay?

thats a good thing.

If his stars hit everything within his radius he would possibly one of the most broken champs in the game, yes he isn't less brain dead to position than other champs (which is also a good thing as there is far too many brain deadness in this game already) but if you do position well it pays off. 

Why would % damage make sense? he's a mage, not a tank. 

Starsurge is used in conjunction with comet of legend and any move speed items you have, if it was easy to keep up with it without those things then you'd just spam lane wide stuns at will, and that offers no counterplay. 

Nothing about Escape velocity gives you a boost of move speed when hit by a champion, i dont think that was ever the case, intact the opposite is true, being hit takes away your stacks.

If he wasn't able to lose stacks then he would too quickly be able to float around everywhere, (again, counterplay) 

A stun is supposed to be a 'disable' to an enemy, but seeming aurelion sol's damage comes passively, a stun doest give the enemy a chance to kill/escape from him because his damage continues regardless, also Stun/silence does work on other champs, like azir and his turrets.
he would have very little counterplay if there was no way of stopping his passive.

Basically, he isn't the easiest champ to play, if you're looking for brain dead champs, unfortunately theres plenty to choose from, but just not this one which is a good thing, the more skill required to play a champion the better!
